sentences.sContent: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.sCn: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

sentences.sContent: ...That people often experience trouble sleeping in a different bed in unfamiliar surroundings is a phenomenon known as the ―first-night‖ effect...
...the phenomenon in which the sun barely sets in northern countries in the summertime...
...This phenomenon has set off an intensifying discussion at hospitals and medical schools about a　problem perhaps best described as "distracted doctoring...
...What this thought-provoking drawing mirrors is the phenomenon that the Internet has penetrated into our life...
...there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred...
...This phenomenon exists for a number of reasons...
...Only in this way can free-admission to museums become a long-lasting phenomenon and have sustainable development...

remMethod.val: “费脑迷呢” → 他费脑筋琢磨这奇特的现象， 却仍迷惑不解 → 现象， 迹象

words.tran: 现象的；显著的；异常的；能知觉的
现象上地；明白地；从感官认识到

trans.tranOther: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand
